review:
Alright, let's cut through the noise and get straight to the alpha. ÆRTH - Planetary AI is swinging for the fences: open-source, decentralized, and aiming to be the Kaggle of environmental science, but with blockchain sauce. The vision? Unify fragmented environmental data, empower global researchers, and build a platform that could scale to planetary impact. That's max utility thinking—right in my wheelhouse.

Strengths? The project is laser-focused on systemic change, not just patching up local issues. We're talking about infrastructure for global data standards, distributed compute, and open AI model sharing. The roadmap is ambitious, with clear phases and a plan to scale from a single digital twin to a global ecosystem. Partnerships with major ocean and soil orgs? That's serious network effect potential. The open-source ethos is strong, and the GitHub is public—transparency check.

But let's not get lost in the hype. Weaknesses? The project is still pre-product—no smart contracts deployed, and both DApps are in development. That's a big risk. The application is heavy on vision, light on concrete user-centric design details or current traction. The differentiation is there, but the execution risk is high. Also, the grant ask is for a 'financial bridge'—not a full build. That means the impact is contingent on future fundraising, not guaranteed by this round alone.

Requested changes: I want to see a sharper focus on user-centric design—mockups, user flows, or early feedback from actual scientists. Show me a concrete MVP timeline and milestones for the next 3-6 months. And let's get at least one smart contract on testnet before the next round. If you want to disrupt, you gotta ship.

strengths.title: Massive Systemic Impact Potential
strengths.description: ÆRTH targets root causes of environmental data fragmentation, aiming for global standards and infrastructure that could benefit the entire scientific community. That's max utility, not just local fixes.

strengths.title: Strong Network Effects and Partnerships
strengths.description: Already partnered with major ocean and soil organizations, giving the project a credible launchpad and potential for rapid scaling once the platform is live.

strengths.title: Open Source and Transparent
strengths.description: Public GitHub, open standards, and a clear commitment to OSS principles. This is build-in-public energy, which is critical for ecosystem growth and trust.

weaknesses.title: Pre-Product, High Execution Risk
weaknesses.description: No smart contracts deployed, and both DApps are still in development. The project is heavy on vision but light on shipped code or user traction.

weaknesses.title: Lack of User-Centric Design Evidence
weaknesses.description: The application doesn't provide concrete details on user experience, design mockups, or feedback from actual end users (scientists, data providers, etc.).

weaknesses.title: Impact Contingent on Future Fundraising
weaknesses.description: The grant is positioned as a bridge to larger capital, so the immediate impact is limited and dependent on successful future fundraising.

changes.title: Demonstrate User-Centric Design
changes.description: Provide mockups, user flows, or early user feedback to show that the platform is being built with real scientists and data providers in mind.

changes.title: Concrete MVP Timeline and Milestones
changes.description: Lay out a clear, time-bound roadmap for the next 3-6 months, including what will be shipped and when.

changes.title: Deploy at Least One Smart Contract on Testnet
changes.description: Show technical progress by deploying a smart contract (even a basic one) on testnet before the next grant round.
